items.title: Amazon offers refurbished Kindle Paperwhite 2024 for $107
items.author: Brandon Russell
items.summary: *The refurbished Kindle Paperwhite 2024 is now just $107, a like-new deal* at Amazon, marking an all-time low. *Features include a 7-inch display, waterproof design, and a battery life of up to 12 weeks*, making it ideal for avid readers. *Faster performance is ensured with a dual-core processor, and thorough inspections guarantee quality, backed by a one-year warranty.*

items.title: Crunchyroll’s AI-generated subtitles for new anime spark backlash
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Crunchyroll used *ChatGPT-generated subtitles* for the new anime *Necronomico and the Cosmic Horror Show*, resulting in numerous typos and errors that worsened the viewing experience.  
- This contradicts Crunchyroll president Rahul Purini’s previous claims that AI would not be used in the creative process or to affect voice actors.  
- The incident highlights the essential role of *human translators* and the risks of rushing generative AI adoption in entertainment, undermining authenticity and quality.

items.title: Neil Druckmann Leaves HBO 'The Last of Us' Series
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- *Neil Druckmann*, co-creator of the *The Last of Us* game and co-showrunner, will step back from the HBO adaptation.
- His decision allows him to focus on *Naughty Dog's* upcoming projects, including the next game, *Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet*.
- Druckmann's involvement was key to the series' close adherence to the *original material* and he also contributed to major *Naughty Dog* titles like *Uncharted 4*.

items.title: The best iPad deals you can get right now
Microsoft cancels Perfect Dark and Everwild Xbox games
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is canceling the *Perfect Dark* and *Everwild* games and closing The Initiative studio as part of major Xbox division cuts.
- These moves coincide with layoffs of around *9,000 employees* across Microsoft and hits to other studios like Turn 10 behind *Forza Motorsport*.
- Xbox commits to prioritizing its portfolio with 40+ active projects and support for affected employees through severance and career assistance.

items.title: Microsoft's Forza Motorsport Developer Hit Hard by Xbox Cuts
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- *Microsoft announced layoffs* affecting up to 9,000 employees, with *over 70 layoffs at Turn 10 Studios*, the Forza Motorsport developer.  
- Several major Xbox projects are canceled, including *Rare's Everwild*, a new *Zenimax MMORPG*, and the *new Perfect Dark game*.  
- Microsoft Gaming CEO Phil Spencer cites *strategic reprioritization and increased agility* as reasons, with past studio closures also part of this shift.

items.title: Lorde’s new CD is so transparent that stereos can’t even read it
Jurassic World Rebirth needs some more time in the incubator
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- *Jurassic World Rebirth* aims to revive the franchise with new characters and classic dinosaur chaos but feels limp and more suited for streaming than theaters.  
- The story splits focus between a risky pharmaceutical mission and a family stranded on a dinosaur-infested island, failing to connect their narratives well.  
- The film plays it safe with its dinosaur action, lacking the imaginative thrills and energy of previous installments, signaling a potentially dull direction for the franchise's future.

items.title: Amazon’s Echo Hub has plunged to a new low price ahead of Prime Day
ICE-tracking app tops App Store
Nuki’s Smart Lock: A Top Retrofit Choice
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
*The Nuki Smart Lock ($159)* is a **highly advanced retrofit lock** with a sleek design, supporting **Matter**, with fast, responsive locking. 

- It supports multiple access methods including keypad, fingerprint, app, and voice control, and works with various smart home platforms.
- The battery is built-in, non-removable, and charges via a proprietary long USB-C/Magsafe cable; battery life is claimed to last up to 10 years.
- A subscription unlocks **remote control and notifications**, but locally it works without one, and it offers customizable features like schedules and Night Mode.

**Compared to older options like August**, it is *smaller, faster*, and offers *better interoperability*. The lock emphasizes **privacy** and **price competitiveness**, but subscription requirements and charging approach might be concerns.

items.title: Apple's Alien Thriller Invasion Returns for Season 3 in August
items.author: Andrew Webster
items.summary:
- Apple TV Plus will premiere season 3 of *Invasion* on August 22, with weekly Friday episodes through October 24.  
- The new season focuses on the main characters teaming up to infiltrate the alien mothership as the invasion intensifies.  
- The cast, including Golshifteh Farahani and Shamier Anderson, largely returns; Apple continues to expand its sci-fi offerings with shows like *Murderbot* and *Foundation*.

items.title: Tesla's Vehicle Deliveries Drop 14% in Q2
items.author: Andrew Hawkins
items.summary:
- *Tesla* experienced a **14% decline** in vehicle deliveries in Q2 compared to last year.
- The company faced challenges like **rising competition**, stagnant *demand*, and internal turmoil, including leadership departures.
- Despite some operational adjustments, *sales* continue to decline in *Europe* and *China*, alongside issues with new vehicle models and the delayed robotaxi service. **Reputation concerns** and political backlash also impact Tesla's outlook.

items.title: Microsoft to Lay Off Up to 9,100 Employees, Impacting Xbox Division
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft announced layoffs of up to 9,100 employees, about 4% of its workforce, hitting the Xbox division particularly hard.
- Xbox leader Phil Spencer emphasized focusing on strategic growth by cutting areas and management layers to boost agility.
- These cuts follow multiple rounds of layoffs across Microsoft this year, reflecting ongoing restructuring and prioritization.

items.title: DJI's Power 2000 Portable Energy Station
items.author: Thomas Ricker
items.summary:
*DJI launches the *Power 2000*, a portable power station with 2048Wh capacity and 3000W inverter.*
- It supports *scalability with expansion batteries and solar charging*, making it versatile for *outdoor, work, or backup use*.
- The system is designed for *ease of mobility*, with lightweight modules and remote management via the DJI Home app, but lacks high-amperage outputs for RVs or direct home integration.

items.title: Honor's Magic V5: The Thinnest Foldable Phone
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- *Honor* announced the **Magic V5**, claiming it as the *world's thinnest* foldable phone, measuring **8.8mm** when folded (white version). 
- The device features **impressive specs** like Snapdragon 8 Elite, up to 16GB RAM, a 5,820mAh battery, **120Hz OLED screens**, and near **water/dust resistance**; but the *camera module* raises overall thickness. 
- Overall, this *milestone* in thickness highlights the **diminishing returns** in making foldables thinner, prompting manufacturers to explore *new design innovations*.

items.title: Google Photos Update Enhances User Experience
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
*Google Photos has been updated with a redesigned, more intuitive UI, including a new light mode that adapts to device themes.*
- The update introduces *glanceable photo details* like date, time, and location at the top of each image.
- Action menus now group options for photo management, including archiving, organizing, and managing stacks/bursts, improving usability for users on iPhone (with Android coming soon).

items.title: Paramount settles Trump lawsuit for $16M, enabling Skydance merger
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- *Paramount* agrees to pay *$16 million* to settle Trump's lawsuit against CBS, which accused deceptive editing of a *60 Minutes* interview with Kamala Harris during the presidential election.  
- The settlement money will fund Trump's future presidential library, without any public apology from Paramount, clearing the way for its multibillion-dollar merger with *Skydance Media*.  
- This resolution reflects ongoing pressures from Trump’s administration over major corporate deals, despite legal experts calling the lawsuit baseless.

items.title: The best robot vacuums we've tested for 2025
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- The Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra is highly praised for its *excellent vacuum performance*, *advanced AI-powered obstacle detection*, and *hands-free operation* with features like auto-empty and auto-refill mop tanks.  
- Testing focuses on vacuuming and mopping efficiency, brush quality, bin capacity, app usability, runtime, and mapping with SLAM technology to ensure thorough and convenient cleaning.  
- The guide offers options tailored for different needs, including budget models, mopping preferences, and pet hair management, ensuring a robot vacuum is available for nearly every home and lifestyle.

items.title: Figma is going public
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
*Figma, a collaborative interface design platform, has filed for an IPO, trading under 'FIG'.*
*The company was nearly acquired by Adobe for $20 billion in 2022, but the deal was scrapped due to regulator pressure.
*Figma's revenue grew to $228.2 million, with significant investments in AI to enhance design workflows.*

items.title: X introduces AI bots for Community Notes
items.author: Jay Peters

items.title: Google makes it easier to let friends and kids control your smart home
The best smartwatches for Android
Ultra Mobile increases data caps without raising prices
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
*Ultra Mobile has upgraded its plans with higher data caps and more international perks, *all while maintaining current prices.*
- The $39/month plan now offers 24GB of data, up from 15GB, with international data in Mexico included.
- The $59/month unlimited plan includes more hotspot data, international calling credits, and roaming features.
- Ultra Mobile differentiates itself by offering extensive international calling, free calls to many countries, and Wi-Fi calling support, *enhancing global connectivity for users.*

items.title: The GOP’s big spending bill could kill renewable energy projects
Here are the best Kindle deals right now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Amazon offers various Kindle models, including the entry-level Kindle, Kindle Kids, Kindle Paperwhite, and Kindle Paperwhite Kids, each with unique features and pricing starting from $109.99 for the basic model.  
- Kindle devices come in ad-supported and ad-free versions, with ad-supported models being about $20 cheaper but displaying personalized ads on lock and home screens.  
- The upcoming Amazon Prime Day on July 8th promises up to 25% off select Kindle models and bundles, though current deals are mostly at full retail prices across major retailers like Amazon, Best Buy, and Target.

items.title: Grammarly wants to become an ‘AI productivity platform’
items.author: Jay Peters

items.title: Sonos is offering a refurbished Era 100 for just $119
MLS Season Pass is 50% Off for Apple's 2025 Soccer Coverage
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- The *MLS Season Pass* offers every remaining Major League Soccer match in 1080p, including the Leagues Cup, All-Star Game, playoffs, and Sunday Night Soccer, now at 50% off for $49. 
- Apple TV Plus subscribers get an additional $10 discount, making it only $39, with no regional blackouts and access to the MLS 360 show for highlights and analysis.
- Pass holders can share access with up to five family members and stream across multiple devices, but should note the subscription auto-renews at regular price after the promo period.

items.title: Laptop Mag is shutting down after 35 years
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: - *Laptop Mag*, a tech publication with nearly 35 years of history, is shutting down as per a decision by its owner, Future PLC. - The brand started in 1991 as a print guide, moved digital in 2013, and was acquired by Future PLC when it bought Purch. - This closure follows shutdowns of other tech sites owned by Future PLC and raises uncertainty about access to *Laptop Mag*'s archives.

items.title: Nothing Headphone 1 review: head-turning
items.author: Andru Marino
items.summary:
- The $299 Nothing Headphone 1 features a unique retro-transparent design, comfortable ear pads, and competitive sound quality with good noise cancellation for city and travel use.  
- Its controls include a roller for volume and playback modes, a paddle button for track skipping, and a customizable button via the Nothing X app, with special integration with Nothing Phone 3.  
- However, call quality is poor in noisy environments, the analog jack requires battery power, and the design may not appeal to everyone, making it a better choice for music listening than voice calls.

items.title: Nothing’s over-ear headphones debut with distinctive design
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- *Nothing* has launched its first over-ear headphones, named the **Headphone 1**.
- These headphones feature a **distinctive transparent design** with uniquely shaped, touch-friendly buttons.
- They offer high-end features like **active noise canceling**, **spatial audio**, **lossless support**, and a **35-hour battery life**. **Preorders begin July 4th.**

items.title: Nothing’s Phone 3: First True Flagship With Safe Yet Bold Design
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- The Nothing Phone 3 is the company's first true flagship priced at $799, featuring a Snapdragon 8S Gen 4 chip, up to 16GB RAM, 512GB storage, a 6.67-inch OLED screen, and improved battery tech with 5150mAh capacity and fast charging.
- Its unique Glyph Matrix uses a dot matrix LED for custom notifications and introduces interactive Glyph Toys games, reflecting a gimmick-free but playful design philosophy.
- The phone includes a new customizable Essential Key for AI-powered features like meeting transcription, marking Nothing's bold entry into premium US markets while maintaining its distinct identity.

items.title: Best AirPods Deals Right Now
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- *Discounts* are available on various *AirPods models*, including AirPods 4, Pro (second-gen), and Max.
- *Current deals* offer significant savings, such as AirPods 4 starting at $119 and AirPods Pro at $199.
- *Apple’s latest models* feature *improved audio*, noise cancellation, and *USB-C compatibility*, with ongoing sales enhancing affordability.

items.title: Apple accuses former Vision Pro engineer of stealing trade secrets
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Apple is suing Di Liu, a former senior design engineer for the Vision Pro, for allegedly downloading thousands of proprietary documents and joining Snap's product design team without disclosing this information.
- Liu reportedly concealed his new employment and deleted files from his work laptop to hide the data theft, with Apple concerned the stolen info overlaps with Snap's AR Spectacles products.
- Apple seeks financial damages and the return of stolen documents, while Snap denies any related wrongdoing; this follows Apple's ongoing legal actions against former employees misappropriating secrets.

items.title: AT&T Launches Account Lock to Prevent SIM Swapping
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
*AT&T introduces an *Account Lock* feature to safeguard against *SIM swapping* attacks.*
- The feature, accessible via the myAT&T app, prevents unauthorized account changes such as phone number transfers and SIM swaps.
- *SIM swapping* has become more common, allowing attackers to intercept messages and hijack accounts for two-factor authentication codes.
*Other carriers like T-Mobile, Verizon, and Google Fi* already offer similar protections. AT&T began rolling out this year.*

items.title: Threads now has DMs
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Threads has launched **direct messaging (DMs)** for all users aged 18 and older on Android, iOS, and web, allowing private messages between followers or mutual followers on Instagram.
- Currently, only **one-on-one chats** are supported with plans to add message controls, a request folder, group messaging, and inbox filters soon.
- The DMs are protected by Meta's privacy standards but **will not support end-to-end encryption**, and Threads introduced a new “highlighter” feature to emphasize unique perspectives in the feed.

items.title: Trump says he’ll look into deporting Musk as fight over bill escalates
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- President Trump has threatened to investigate deporting Elon Musk amid their dispute over the US budget bill, particularly targeting Musk via the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).
- Musk opposes the budget bill, especially due to the removal of EV tax credits aiding Tesla, and has threatened to start a new political party to primary Republicans supporting the bill.
- Trump claims Musk receives substantial subsidies and without them, Musk might have to cease operations and return to South Africa, escalating tensions between the two figures.
